children.content: Compare Graph Database and Network Model

At first glance, CODASYLâ€™s network model looks similar to the graph model. Are graph databases the second coming of CODASYL in disguise?
No. They differ in several important ways
There is no schema. Any vertex can have an edge to any other vertex
The schema is fixed that specified which record type could be nested within which other record type
Usually the vertex has both incoming edges and outgoing edges, and also a unique ID, so it can lead you to any vertex from any vertex
The only way to reach a particular record was to traverse one of the access paths to it
Graph Database is much easier to access
Vertices and edges are not ordered, one can only sort the results after the query executed
The children of a record are an ordered set, so it has to maintain that ordering, which has consequences for the storage layout
Graph Database is much easier to write
Both Cypher and SPARQL are declarative query languages
Graph Database is much easier to query
